identity.title: Post-contemporary Manifesto
identity.description:
Today, the need to obtain what we want comes before the desire itself: we live in the here and now, in the all and now and in the era of the blue tick. 

 We need to rediscover the ability to think in the long term, to think of a human project, initially in terms of ethics and culture and then in terms of politics and economics, which can outline the characteristics of a new type of society. 

 This society can unite the liberal meta-project in favor of individual projects with a guiding framework on the kind of society we would like to build together and the social meaning of living together as a community. 

 We should not be subjected to technological progress but manage it according to participatory and conscious governance of innovation in order to solve the massive cultural, social, environmental, and economic issues. 

 The Internet has gone from being a tool of freedom to a tool of surveillance, with our data as the end product. 

 To reverse this alarming trend, we have decentralized and opened up the network that allows us to restore autonomy, privacy, and security.

 Our way of life is changing, and so are the cities we live in: they are becoming green, digital, responsive, and placing technology at the service of man.  

 In this context, art plays a key role in the rebirth of our society. 

 Thanks to it, three key characteristics can be fostered: sociability, activity, and 

 Art is a kind of training ground in which individuals and communities can experiment and search for their own authenticity and global perspective.

 The function of art is to be a mouthpiece for change, intercepting the future and outlining innovative trajectories and scenarios in such a way as to foreshadow a new vision of the world to be incorporated into the present to act in a conscious and participatory manner towards the design of a better future.  

 Art must be like an enzyme that activates innovative processes and contaminates our lives. 

 In such a delicate historical moment like the one we are living in, there is need for a cultural revolution to bring about human evolution.
identity.subtitle: The historical moment in which we live confronts us with the need to investigate the potential and critical aspects of the use of new technologies, so as not to be subjected to them and instead give life to a conscious and participatory 'governance of innovation'. Reasoned Art was created with this aim in mind: to propose an innovative vision of the present through art's ability to intercept the future.
identity.download_text: You can  also see the manifesto of Reasoned Art on GitHub or download it here:

privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.download: You can also download the document.

slide.title1: Applicability of the Terms and Conditions
slide.text1: These Terms and Conditions form a legally binding agreement (the 'Agreement') between  Art company benefit srl (' Art' or 'We') and the User ('You'). These Terms and Conditions govern the access and use of the website and the Blockchain  Art Platform, including any pages and domains within the website, applications for smartphones, tablets and other devices, application interfaces (together referred to as ' Platform ') and all associated services offered through the Platform (collectively referred to as the ' Service '). We will refer to the Platform and the Service as 'Online Site'. Any (legal) term and concept used in these Terms and Conditions must in any case be interpreted in accordance with Italian law.
slide.text3:
The protection of personal information is very important  Art. The User can consult the Privacy Policy to find out how his personal information is processed. By using the online Site, the User consents to the use of his information for the purposes established in the Privacy Policy.
To allow you to fulfill the obligations deriving from a Sale and Purchase Agreement, we make available to Users who request it the necessary personal information (such as name, e-mail address, telephone number and address) of Other Users.
However Art cannot be held responsible for the accuracy of personal data disclosed by Users. Art and the User who receives the aforementioned personal data from Other Users are considered separate and independent data controllers, pursuant to the applicable laws and regulations regarding the protection of personal data, such as the EU Regulation no. 679 of 2016. In the event  Art and a User are jointly responsible for the processing of relevant personal data, and in the event  Art is sued, fined or otherwise suffers damages for any deficiency that can be attributed to the 'User in question, the User agrees to  Art for such damages.
In the event that the User receives the personal data of another subscriber, he must guarantee to process such information only to fulfill his obligations or to resolve any problems arising from the Sale and Purchase Agreement. The processing of such data by the User must take place in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations (on data protection).
slide.text4:
Each transaction on the Platform is subject to Fees that Users are required to pay  Art.
The amount of the Fees for the sale of an NFT varies depending on whether it is the first sale of the token ('Primary Sale') or a subsequent sale in the secondary market ('Secondary Sale').
In particular Art collects an equal commission:
• At 25% of the value of the first sale of the NFT;
• At 3% of the value of each subsequent sale concluded on  Art Platform.
All Fees are collected and distributed upon transfer of the NFT via Smart Contracts.

to. Primary sale
The Artist receives 75% of the total sale price for primary sales and  Art 25% of the total sale price as a Commission for the services offered, including the minting of NFTs.

b Sale in the secondary market
Artists receive a royalty equal to 10% of the hammer price, for all sales made in the secondary market. This royalty is paid by the User who owns the NFT (former Buyer of the same), who sells the token. Art, as part of the services offered, retains a royalty equal to 3% of the sale price.

c. Automated collection and payment of commissions and royalties by Smart Contracts.
The User accepts and understands that all commissions, rights granted with the sale and royalties are transferred, processed or initiated directly through one or more Smart Contracts on the Polygon blockchain network.
The User consents to the automated collection and disbursement of royalties to Artists for sales on the NFT secondary market.
slide.text5:
Before you can use the Online Site, you must create  Art account ('Account'). Normally, anyone can subscribe  Art. If the User is under the age of 18, however, he must obtain the consent of his guardian or legal guardians.
The following are the rules relating to the use of the Account:
• Obligation to Provide Accurate Information. During the creation of the Account, the User is required to provide complete and truthful information about himself or his company. It is not allowed to use false information or to pretend to be another person or company through your Account. You must always keep this information up to date.
• Choosing a suitable username  Art requires its Users to choose a username that is not or cannot be considered offensive or vulgar, and that does not infringe the intellectual property rights of third parties or, otherwise, these Terms and Conditions.
• Account Protection . The combination of username and password must always be kept secret. The User is solely responsible for any activity relating to his Account with the express release  Art from any and all liability including the subtraction, by any means, of the above combination Art has the right to assume that only the User is able to log in using his username and password.
• Account Restrictions. To ensure that the Online Site is and remains reliable and secure,  Art reserves the right (i) to deny the User the ability to create an Account, (ii) to restrict its use and (iii) to deny its right to access the Account.
In case of violation of the Terms and Conditions, registration will no longer be allowed. In the event that the User's access or use of the Online Site has been restricted in accordance with the Terms and Conditions, it will not be permitted to sign up with another Account or access and use the Online Site through the Account of a other User.
slide.title8: Modification of the Terms of Use
slide.text9:
Termination by the User. The User can remove his Account at any time.  Art has the right to refuse the removal of the Account if it is still necessary to fulfill certain obligations (such as payment or delivery obligations) towards  Art or other Users.
Termination by  Art. Any breach of these Terms and Conditions may result in the immediate termination of an Account without any formal requirements being necessary.
Suspension of the Service.  Art has the right to suspend the Service if it has sufficient reasons to believe that the User is not acting in accordance with these Terms and Conditions. For the avoidance of doubt, this means that  Art reserves the right to suspend the use of all Accounts used or managed by the User.
 Art reserves the right to take additional protective measures. In addition to the above,  Art reserves the right to take any further measures to protect the Online Site and Other Users from unlawful, fraudulent or otherwise inappropriate behavior.
slide.text10:
These Terms and Conditions are governed by Italian law.
Any dispute arising from the signing, validity, effectiveness, interpretation or execution of these Terms and Conditions and from relations derived from them or related to them, will be the exclusive competence of the Court of Genoa.
